title: Period Health
description: Understanding your menstrual cycle is key to understanding your overall health. Tracking your cycle can provide insights into your hormones, fertility, and well-being.
sentences: A typical menstrual cycle lasts between 21 and 35 days.
Track your cycle using an app to monitor length, symptoms, and flow.
Common PMS symptoms include bloating, cramps, mood swings, and fatigue.
Different period products are available; find what works best for you (pads, tampons, cups, discs, underwear).
Your cycle can be affected by stress, diet, exercise, and sleep.
dos: Eat iron-rich foods during your period to combat fatigue.
Engage in gentle exercise like walking or yoga to ease cramps.
Use a heat pad to help with menstrual pain.
Talk to your doctor about severe pain or irregular cycles.
donts: Don't ignore severe pain that disrupts your daily life.
Don't feel ashamed or embarrassed to talk about your period.
Don't forget to change your tampon, pad, or empty your cup regularly.
Don't rely solely on caffeine for energy; prioritize rest.
